page.title: 17STORNOWAY S. THE GAZETTE
page.content: In January 1917 the first local paper in the Western Isles was published - {The Stornoway Gazette & West Coast Advertiser. The paper now goes to at least 12 different countries including East & West Germany, france, Belgium, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, Abu Dhabi, Hong Kong, New Zealand, Australia, Russia and South America. Today the Gazette employs 18 people; 2 reporters, a photographer, 4 printers, 3 clerkesses, and 8 in the case room. The Gazette is a weekly paper with a circulation of about 13000. It has regular features such as nature notes, Gaelic, news from local correspondants, and the letters page. A Webb Offset system is used for printing. People mostly read the small ads. pages but the main story this year was the Royal visit from the Prince and Princess of Wales.
